question: I am in the midst of a maddening problem with my face -- and it's frightening.  Eight weeks ago, after a sinus infection, my face started swelling slightly and now it's still swollen and itches and burns and twitches -- "crawling" sensations" -- but no one can see anything from the outside.  It feels like I've got insects crawling on my face and it's 24/7.  I need Ambien to fall asleep at night.  Now my lips itch a bit too.So far:-- several internists have said "I don't know" (and it seemed they didn't care either)-- the neurologist said I've got a "clear MRI of the brain" (another one who didn't care)-- the allergist says I'm not allergic to anything I breath or eat-- the dentist said it's not oralI have diabetes, high cholesterol, and slightly elevated blood pressure, and peripheral neuropathy -- for about seven years -- and take several medications, including:  Gabapentin, Lisinopril, Simvastin, Metformin, and now some to treat the possible allergy.
title: Facial swelling, burning, itching, and crawling
